meanings.definition: To coat or decorate with a pattern resembling marble.
meanings.sent1: She decided to marbleize her phone case with swirls of color.
meanings.sent2: The artist used special paint to marbleize the tabletop.
meanings.sent3: The chef attempted to marbleize the cake, but it ended up looking more like a rainbow.
meanings.sent4: The sunlight seemed to marbleize the water, creating a shimmering effect.
meanings.sent5: The decorator's skillful hands were able to marbleize the walls beautifully.

meanings.definition: To give a marble-like appearance to something.
meanings.sent1: The new flooring will marbleize the room and make it look elegant.
meanings.sent2: Using a special technique, she was able to marbleize the plain vase.
meanings.sent3: The magician's wand seemed to marbleize the air around it.
meanings.sent4: The fog began to marbleize the landscape, turning everything into a soft blur.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brush strokes were able to marbleize the canvas with precision.
